intro: Kedhalia, commonly known as the "wild bean plant," is a flowering plant native to tropical regions. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties. The plant features compound leaves and produces small, pod-like fruits containing edible seeds. Kedhalia is often found growing in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical structure supports nitrogen fixation, contributing to soil fertility in its natural habitat.
